cosiness noun [U]
(CLOSENESS)
disapproving a close relationship that is convenient for those involved but may not be honest or morally right: the cosiness between politicians and banks
More examplesFewer examplesHe criticized the administration's cosiness with authoritarian regimes.Most big businesses, despite their cosiness with the current government, would prefer an opposition government to a prolonged period of political instability. There were calls to break up the cosiness of the company's board.
